subject: Writing
title: Derek Walcott: Between Two Worlds
description: One-minute skill: Derek Walcott: Between Two Worlds.

hook.text: Born in St. Lucia with African and European ancestry, Walcott said he had 'two halves of a divided mind.'

buildup.text: His poetry fused Caribbean landscapes, colonial history, and classical European literary forms.

discovery.text: Omeros, his epic poem, retold Homer's Odyssey through the lives of Caribbean fishermen.

twist.text: Critics asked if he was African or European. He answered: both, and that's the whole point of the Caribbean.

climax.text: He won the Nobel Prize in 1992 for verse that made the postcolonial experience into universal poetry.

punchline.text: He turned a divided identity into the richest poetry.

quiz.question: What classical work did Walcott reimagine in his epic poem Omeros?
